current-chamber._: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action-desc._: Received; read twice and referred to the

committee-name._: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action-instruction: Omit the part struck through and insert the part printed in italic

official-title._:
To authorize the acquisition and protection of nationally significant battlefields and associated
			 sites of the Revolutionary War and the War of 1812 under the American
			 Battlefield Protection Program.

text._:
This Act may be cited as the
			 "American Battlefield Protection
			 Program Amendments Act of 2013".

header:
Revolutionary War
			 and War of 1812 American battlefield protection

text._:
Section 7301(c) of the Omnibus Public Land
			 Management Act of 2009 () is amended as
			 follows:

text:
by striking
			 subparagraph (A) and inserting the following:

the report
				entitled "Report on the Nation’s Civil War Battlefields", prepared
				by the Civil War Sites Advisory Commission, and dated July 1993;
			 and

the report
				entitled "Report to Congress on the Historic Preservation of Revolutionary
				War and War of 1812 Sites in the United States", prepared by the National
				Park Service, and dated September 2007.

in subparagraph
			 (C)(ii), by striking "Battlefield Report" and inserting
			 "battlefield report".

In paragraph (2),
			 by inserting "eligible sites or" after
			 "acquiring".

text._:
In paragraph (3), by inserting "an
			 eligible site or" after "acquire".

In paragraph (4), by inserting "an
			 eligible site or" after "acquiring".

text:
In paragraph (5),
			 by striking "An" and inserting "An eligible site or
			 an".

By inserting after
			 paragraph (5) the following new paragraphs:

text._:
Acquisition of land
				or interests in land under this subsection shall be from willing
			 sellers
				only.

Not later than 5 years after the date of
				the enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall submit to
			 Congress a
				report on the activities carried out under this subsection,
			 including a
				description of—

text:
preservation
				activities carried out at the battlefields and associated sites
			 identified in
				the battlefield report during the period between publication of the
			 battlefield
				report and the report required under this paragraph;

changes in the
				condition of the battlefields and associated sites during that
			 period;
				and

any other relevant
				developments relating to the battlefields and associated sites
			 during that
				period.

None of the funds provided pursuant to this section may
				be used for purposes of lobbying any person or entity regarding the
				implementation of this section or be granted, awarded, contracted,
			 or otherwise
				be made available to any person, organization, or entity that
			 participates in
				such lobbying.

For purposes of this paragraph, the term
				"lobbying" means to directly or indirectly pay for any personal
				service, advertisement, telegram, telephone call, letter, printed
			 or written
				matter, or other device intended or designed to influence in any
			 manner a
				Member of Congress, a jurisdiction, or an official of any
			 government to favor,
				adopt, or oppose by vote or otherwise, any legislation, law,
			 ratification,
				policy, land use plan (including zoning), or appropriation of funds
			 before or
				after the introduction of any bill, resolution, or other measure
			 proposing such
				legislation, law, ratification, policy, or
				appropriation.

None of the funds provided pursuant to this section shall be used in any way, directly or
			 indirectly, to influence congressional action on any legislation or
			 appropriation matters pending before Congress.

In paragraph (9)
			 (as redesignated by paragraph (6)), by striking "2013" and
			 inserting "2018".
